title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 October 2014 - XWiki
content:
<OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
01:26 <OSIMasson> has quit  
06:47 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
06:55 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:21 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
07:23 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:25 <Lyes> has quit  
07:34 <mflorea> has quit  
07:45 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:06 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <Lyes> has quit  
08:29 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <Lyes> has quit  
08:37 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
08:55 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, does anybody know where "secret" is created in xwiki rest api? I'm facing issue when restlet fails authenticating user because of "WARNING: Couldn't find any helper support the HTTP\_Negotiate challenge scheme." and hence secret is null... i'm even wondering why is restlet doing authentication, since it should be done on xwiki side  
09:11 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <Lyes> has quit  
09:18 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <Enygma`> Hi  
09:43 <Enygma`> I have been seeing quite a few of these lately: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Sonar/59/console  
09:43 <Enygma`> Failed to dispose XWiki context: Cache 'configuration.document.wiki' is in 'TERMINATED' state and so it does not accept new invocations. Either restart it or recreate the cache container.  
09:44 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: I`ve left you a message on Friday about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/VelocityMacrosTest/testUsingMacroInGetRenderedContent/  
09:44 <Enygma`> do you have any idea what may cause it or how to fix it?  
09:44 <gdelhumeau> Hi Enygma`  
09:44 <gdelhumeau> I'm looking  
09:45 <Enygma`> need to do the release today and that looks like a blocker to me  
09:47 <Enygma`> the screenshot is http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/ws/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/target/selenium-screenshots/org.xwiki.test.selenium.VelocityMacrosTest-testUsingMacroInGetRenderedContent.png  
09:47 <Enygma`> and the problem is that macros defined in the skin object are not visible in the documents  
10:01 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <Gabriela> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`: can I commit my work about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10333 to have a first version in 6.3M2 or sould I wait RC1?  
10:24 <Lyes> has quit  
10:25 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: if you think it's safe enough, go for it  
10:30 <gdelhumeau> good  
10:30 <gdelhumeau> thanks  
10:38 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: see also my last comment in jira on this  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> yes, I will try to implement the Eddy idea for the RC1  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> should be easy thought  
10:46 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: a webjar defined as a dependency of a XAR (panels-ui) which is a dependency of XE xar (xwiki-enterprise-ui-common) should end up in the enterprise WAR? Or at least in the jetty distribution?  
10:47 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: I am having a look at the latest snapshot, and it seems that the <body> element has a lot of stuff in it that should be present in <head> instead, like: meta, script, link, etc  
10:47 <Enygma`> I know you worked recently on that area  
10:47 <vmassol> the WAR is about jars not UI  
10:48 <vmassol> just do a mvn dependency:tree on the enterprise WAR and you'll see what gets included  
10:48 <vmassol> the WAR module doesn't have deps on XARs....  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> and I think the default jetty distribution will not bundled the webjar then  
10:50 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: are you aware of the problem / planning to fix it?  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> I will create a JIRA  
10:52 <vmassol> the XARs should have runtime deps on the JARs and indeed the WAR will also need to have deps on any webjar module required (directly or through other deps that require them)  
10:52 <vmassol> so it's true that if it's only a XAR that requires a webjar, then it won't be in the distribution if not added to the WAR's pom.xml  
10:54 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: scratch that last thing. I was testing the view.vm template and it seems that when I add some output at the beginning on that file, 80% of the elements that are supposed to end up in <head> end up in <body> instead  
10:55 <Enygma`> if I remove the output from view.vm, <head> contains the right elements  
10:55 <Enygma`> perhaps something buggy with our placeholder code that injects <head> elements  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11330  
10:56 <vmassol> but it shouldn't IMO ;)  
10:56 <vmassol> (I don't see how it could…)  
10:56 <gdelhumeau> ok good Enygma` :)  
10:57 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you have an idea for automation? (I don't see it in the issue description)  
10:58 <vmassol> well there's one I can think of actually  
10:58 <vmassol> I'll comment in the jira issue  
10:58 <vmassol> now  
11:00 <vmassol> done  
11:01 <lucaa> has quit  
11:03 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <Inge-> Trying my first clean xwiki install in a few years now.  
11:10 <vmassol> :)  
11:11 <Lyes> has quit  
11:11 <Panther\_1> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <Panther\_1> hi  
11:13 <Panther\_1> anyone here knowing how prevent an exception if "/bin/view/Main/DatabaseSearch?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain&text=%00" is executed?  
11:15 <vmassol> Panther\_1: using the SOLR search maybe (if your install is not too old)?  
11:16 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <Panther\_1> vmassol: is a current 6.2  
11:16 <vmassol> Panther\_1: you get this:  
11:16 <vmassol> org.jdom.IllegalDataException: The data "RSS feed for search on " is not legal for a JDOM character content: 0x0 is not a legal XML character.  
11:16 <vmassol> ?  
11:16 <vmassol> you should report a jira issue for this anyway  
11:16 <vmassol> Panther\_1: yes you should really use SOLR in 6.2  
11:17 <vmassol> go in the search admin UI  
11:17 <vmassol> and select SOLR  
11:17 <cjd> hm  
11:17 <Panther\_1> vmassol: we have an external security scanner runing on our side the found thix  
11:17 <cjd> should gracefully reject \0 in a search  
11:17 <cjd> it's totally invalid  
11:17 <vmassol> there's no security issue with it, it's just that the computed RSS fails  
11:19 <Panther\_1> vmassol: yes bt the report every exception cause the exceptions are printed with line numbers and so on  
11:19 <Panther\_1> vmassol: /bin/view/Main/DatabaseSearch?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain&text=%00] WARN  o.h.u.JDBCExceptionReporter    - SQL Error: 0, SQLState: 22021  
11:19 <Panther\_1> vmassol: bin/view/Main/DatabaseSearch?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain&text=%00] ERROR o.h.u.JDBCExceptionReporter    - ERROR: invalid byte sequence for encoding "UTF8": 0x00  
11:19 <vmassol> it's an open source software :)  
11:19 <vmassol> so if someone wants to see the source code they can :)  
11:20 <vmassol> (if that's your concern)  
11:20 <Panther\_1> vmassol: this is what I reported to them  
11:20 <Panther\_1> vmassol: but I must do it on every finding  
11:20 <vmassol> in any case for this specific issue you can open a jira issue  
11:21 <cjd> personally, if the bug is that you can see a stack trace, I'd notabug this one  
11:21 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <Panther\_1> cjd: no thats not the bug  
11:21 <vmassol> cjd: when I try it  
11:21 <vmassol> I get a white screen  
11:21 <cjd> I mean from a security perspective, you have to eventually draw the line about where you stop caring  
11:21 <vmassol> and a stack trace in the logs  
11:21 <vmassol> so it is a bug  
11:21 <vmassol> from a UI perspective  
11:21 <cjd> \0 is an invalid input  
11:22 <cjd> basically it is prema face evidence of an attack  
11:22 <Panther\_1> cjd: yes but it ssems that it will go to the jdbc see above logs  
11:22 <vmassol> Panther\_1: I don't see that btw  
11:22 <vmassol> on 6.3-SNASPHOT  
11:22 <Inge-> I expect xwiki to be sql-injection-proof?  
11:22 <vmassol> (but should be the same on 6.2 I guess)  
11:23 <cjd> he's using sql search instead of SOLR  
11:23 <cjd> Inge-: proof :)  
11:23 <vmassol> sure but using the URL should lead to the same rsult  
11:23 <vmassol> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/DatabaseSearch?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain&text=%00  
11:24 <Inge-> heh  
11:24 <Inge-> cjd: I didn't say it was un-hackable, just that it didn't open for sql-injection attacks :P  
11:25 <Inge-> hm. the Installer has a nice little UI refresh, otherwise it looks pretty similar  
11:25 <cjd> IMO if someone passes url encoded nulls in a query parameter, the wiki should not be corrupted or crash but other than that it's undefined behavior\*  
11:26 <cjd> \* http://www.catb.org/jargon/html/N/nasal-demons.html  
11:27 <woshilapin> has quit  
11:27 <Panther\_1> cjd: even if you use the solr search the url is reachable  
11:27 <cjd> "reachable" ?  
11:29 <Lyes> has quit  
11:29 <Panther\_1> cjd: via direct access like many securtiy scanners do  
11:30 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <DarkKnightCZ> Panther\_1: the url will always be reachable... you might want to do filtering on application server side (or if you use some proxy behind application server, that would be even better)  
11:53 <Lyes> has quit  
11:55 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <Lyes> has quit  
12:02 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <Lyes> has quit  
12:10 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
12:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
12:16 <Inge-> hm. completed the xwiki installation from package, opened the website, completed the wizard... everything completes, then it gives me Error number 4001: Error while parsing velocity page, on /xwiki/bin/view/main - any known installation bugs I should be aware of?  
12:23 <Inge-> If I was going to guess it would be that it times out  
12:28 <vmassol> Inge-: looks bad, it should work seamlessly. What version did you install?  
12:29 <vmassol> also could you pastebin the whole stack?  
12:30 <Inge-> I installed xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-mysql from http://maven.xwiki.org/stable/xwiki-stable.list  
12:31 <Inge-> Hm. Any tips on how to get the whole stack?  
12:32 <Inge-> the webpage itslef is lacking some styling, only shows that single error (along with some un-styled UI elements)  
12:33 <vmassol> Inge-: check the xwiki log file  
12:33 <vmassol> (catalina.out to be precise in your case)  
12:34 <Inge-> Ok, wilco. also i says at the bottom "The requested document could not be found"  
12:35 <Inge->  /i/it/  
12:38 <Inge-> ahah. OutOfMemoryException  
12:39 <Inge-> In my notes from last time I did JAVA\_OPTS="-Djava.awt.headless=true -Xmx1536m -XX:MaxPermSize=192m -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=100"  
12:39 <vmassol> interesting, should be reported  in a jira issue if we need to setup a tomcat with more memory in the package  
12:39 <Inge-> but that was after I had successfully logged in  
12:39 <vmassol> the required memory is defined here:  
12:39 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HMemory  
12:41 <Inge-> right  
12:48 <Inge-> updated JAVA\_OPTS. restarting. looks better. now  
12:55 <lucaa> has quit  
12:56 <Inge-> Did the default credentials change?  Admin/admin is not working (nor admin/admin)  
12:56 <gdelhumeau> it should  
12:59 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`: we cannot release  
12:59 <gdelhumeau> DW is still broken when you create a new subwiki  
13:08 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: let`s wait for this new build and see if it`s fixed there  
13:11 <msmeria> has quit  
13:13 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <Inge-> Hm. I am getting the main page and able to edit it and save it, but it is very slow going at 100% cpu (2ghz cpu) - and still getting some out of memory errors. VM running with 4GB of RAM.  
13:15 <Inge-> well, saving it hasn't returned yet, so still waiting to see if save is successful.  
13:16 <msmeria> has quit  
13:16 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:23 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
13:31 <Inge-> quick Q: I see the http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HMemory is talking about CATALINA\_OPTS while I changed /etc/init.d/tomcat JAVA\_OPTS. Am I making the change in the right place?  
13:33 <Inge-> answer: um no, for running only xwiki on tomcat, shouldn't matter  
13:36 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <Inge-> could the memory issues have made it fail during installation so the user Admin/admin was not created?  
13:39 <Lyes> has quit  
13:39 <Inge-> "Warning: Your wiki seems empty. You may want to import the default XWiki Enterprise wiki which contains a set of useful pages:"  
13:40 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <vmassol> Inge-: indeed that's bad, the DW has not imported any page  
13:46 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:46 <Inge-> hm. ok, I will try to do an install on another machine - but change the JAVA\_OPTS before opening the browser for the first time.  
13:52 <Panther\_1> has left #xwiki  
14:06 <Lyes> has quit  
14:08 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <Inge-> Hm. This time I updated /etc/init.d/tomcat7 to the larger memory setting once the package was installed, and before hitting :8080/xwiki for the first time. I got an "unauthorized request" during the install of the default wiki content - and the "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space" exceptions.  
14:59 <andreeapopescu> has left #xwiki  
15:00 <Inge-> (on a clean and updated ubuntu 14.04 install)  
15:01 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: the DW problem looks fixed now  
15:13 <vmassol> preparing RN for 6.2.3  
15:15 <msmeria> has quit  
15:25 <Inge-> hm. exported CATALINA\_OPTS (identical to JAVA\_OPTS in /etc/init.d/tomcat7), and this time the install seems to have worked. Perhaps I got the wrong JAVA\_OPTS in tomcat7 file.  
15:27 <Inge-> I spoke too soon. the Less compiler still barfed at me  
15:44 <Inge-> vmassol: Update: I set both env. var. CATALINA\_OPTS and the default JAVA\_OPTS to the following, restarted tomcat7 and refreshed the page: "-server -Xms1600m -Xmx1600m -XX:MaxPermSize=384m -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -Djava.awt.headless=true -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=100"  
15:44 <Inge-> Now I got the "welcome to your wiki" and logged in as administrator.  
15:44 <vmassol> 1600m is a lot  
15:44 <Inge-> 800m didn't seem to do the job  
15:45 <vmassol> default wiki pages?  
15:45 <vmassol> 800m as the best memory required is really a lot… too much  
15:47 <Inge-> yeah, just installed the default pages that come with the package  
15:51 <Inge-> hm. I am \*still\* getting the out of memory issue. Perhaps I am doing it wrong  
15:55 <Inge-> if I do ps aux | grep java I get a single process for catalina, but it uses -Xmx128m  
15:55 <Inge-> so I am definitely not doing it right.  
15:56 <DarkKnightCZ> Inge-: look into tomcat/bin/setenv.sh if it exists (and perhaps share the init script on pastebin or similar service)  
16:12 <Inge-> if that would be /usr/share/tomcat7/bin, then there is a catalina.sh but no setenv.sh  
16:12 <Inge-> in fact, no setenv.sh on the whole image  
16:14 <vmassol> Inge-: you could also check catalina.sh  
16:14 <vmassol> I remember documenting how to set the memory for tomcat on xwiki.org  
16:14 <vmassol> let me check  
16:14 <vmassol> I guess you've read http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationTomcat#HOutOfMemoryError ?  
16:15 <vmassol> Inge-: there's no setenve.sh you need to create one ;)  
16:17 <Inge-> \*cough\*  
16:20 <DarkKnightCZ> it's possible the init script doesn't export variables correctly... all tomcat-specific settings (both CATALINA\_OPTS and JAVA\_OPTS) should be in setenv.sh  
16:24 <Inge-> right. bac in 4.x days, I just edited this in /etc/init.d/tomcat7  
16:24 <Inge-> back\*  
16:24 <lucaa> has quit  
16:28 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <Inge-> ok, I got it to read the CATALINA\_OPTS as exported from setenv.sh. It seems it is also getting the setting from somewhere else too, so it starts java with both -Xmx128m AND -Xmx800m  
16:31 <Inge-> I guess we are far outside xwiki itself at this point :)  
16:42 <Inge-> Found it.  
16:43 <Inge-> If I create setenv.sh and export CATALINA\_OPTS, then it gets one -Xmx setting from there as well as one setting from JAVA\_OPTS that it exports somewhere else. If I instead export JAVA\_OPTS, I get my own settings.  
16:45 <Lyes> has quit  
16:46 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
16:47 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:48 <Inge-> That also did wonders for the performance.  
16:48 <Inge-> Thanks for the help.  
16:48 <vmassol> cool  
16:52 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <vmassol> I don't like this solution too much gdelhumeau  
16:56 <vmassol> going to comment

19:00 <vmassol> I can wait

21:13 <Enygma`> vmassol: Yes
